meanings.definition: The front part of the human body below the chest, containing the stomach and bowels.
meanings.sent1: His belly rumbled loudly when he was hungry.
meanings.sent2: She patted her belly after a satisfying meal.
meanings.sent3: The belly of the beast was full of surprises.
meanings.sent4: The treasure was hidden deep within the belly of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The baby's belly button was like a tiny knot.

meanings.definition: The rounded underside of a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The waves crashed against the belly of the boat.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inspected the aircraft's belly for any damage.
meanings.sent3: The belly of the ship glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The belly of the plane gleamed silver in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The barnacles clung to the belly of the ship.

meanings.definition: The part of a violin, guitar, or other musical instrument that faces outward.
meanings.sent1: The violinist carefully polished the belly of her instrument.
meanings.sent2: The guitar maker crafted a beautiful design on the instrument's belly.
meanings.sent3: The belly of the cello reflected the stage lights.
meanings.sent4: The intricate patterns on the belly of the guitar caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The musician tapped the belly of the drum, creating a deep sound.
